registry.title: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) and Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP) Parameters
registry.note: For the Civic Address Types Registry , please see: http://www.iana.org/assignments/civic-address-types-registry

registry.title: BOOTP Vendor Extensions and DHCP Options
registry.note: The Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP) describes an IP/UDP bootstrap protocol (BOOTP) which allows a diskless client machine to discover its own IP address, the address of a server host, and the name of a file to be loaded into memory and executed. The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) provides a framework for automatic configuration of IP hosts. The document "DHCP Options and BOOTP Vendor Information Extensions" describes options for DHCP, some of which can also be used with BOOTP. Additional DHCP options are described in other RFCs, as documented in this registry.

record.name: Time Offset
record.description: Time Offset in Seconds from UTC (note: deprecated by 100 and 101)

record.name: Boot File Size
record.description: Size of boot file in 512 byte chunks

record.name: Merit Dump File
record.description: Client to dump and name the file to dump it to

record.name: Domain Name
record.description: The DNS domain name of the client

record.name: Extension File
record.description: Path name for more BOOTP info

record.name: IPv6-Only Preferred
record.description: Number of seconds that DHCPv4 should be disabled

record.name: OPTION_DHCP4O6_S46_SADDR
record.description: DHCPv4 over DHCPv6 Softwire Source Address Option

record.name: TFTP Server IP address (for IP Phone software load)
Diffserv Code Point (DSCP) for VoIP signalling and media streams
SIP UA Configuration Service Domains
record.description: List of domain names to search for SIP User Agent Configuration

record.name: OPTION-IPv4_Address-ANDSF
record.description: ANDSF IPv4 Address Option for DHCPv4

record.name: OPTION_V4_SZTP_REDIRECT
record.description: This option provides a list of URIs for SZTP bootstrap servers

record.name: OPTION_V4_DOTS_RI
record.description: The name of the peer DOTS agent.

record.name: OPTION_V4_DOTS_ADDRESS
record.description: N/4 IPv4 addresses of peer DOTS agent(s).

record.name: status-code
record.description: Status code and optional N byte text message describing status.

record.name: base-time
record.description: Absolute time (seconds since Jan 1, 1970) message was sent.

record.name: start-time-of-state
record.description: Number of seconds in the past when client entered current state.

record.name: query-start-time
record.description: Absolute time (seconds since Jan 1, 1970) for beginning of query.

record.name: query-end-time
record.description: Absolute time (seconds since Jan 1, 1970) for end of query.

record.name: data-source
record.description: Indicates information came from local or remote server.

record.name: OPTION_V4_PCP_SERVER
record.description: Includes one or multiple lists of PCP server IP addresses; each list is treated as a separate PCP server.

record.name: OPTION_V4_PORTPARAMS
record.description: This option is used to configure a set of ports bound to a shared IPv4 address.

record.name: Unassigned
record.description: Previously assigned by ; known to also be used by Polycom.

the group of all PacketCable Call Management Servers used by the CCD.
